description: Home to an internationally renowned art collection, Inigo Jonesâ€™ architectural masterpiece is the first Classical building in the UK. Home to the largest collection of Maritime art and currently hosting an exhibition on the Van de Velde's.

factsheet.heading: Van de Velde Tour and visit on the Loggia
paragraphs: We will be running our usually paid Van de Veldes tour for free over the weekend. This includes some history of the house but is an depth look at our current exhibition written and given by a member of the visitor and sales team. As part of this visitors on the tour are able to step out onto the Loggia overlooking Greenwich Park and the Observatory. A space that is not open to the general public.
Due to Health and Safety restrictions children under 12 are unable to go out onto the Loggia.

factsheet.heading: Free Talks
paragraphs: We will also aim to have a few informal talks and gallery favourites throughout the day covering a range of subjects from the architecture of the house to the Kings and Queen's that graced it's halls. Our visitor and sales team are passionate and love to share the history of the house with those that visit.

factsheet.heading: Drawing Workshop
paragraphs: We will also be hosting our drop in drawing workshop which takes place on a stage in our shop. Join a member of staff and draw portraits of famous Kings and Queen's.

factsheet.heading: Storytelling Workshop
paragraphs: Join a member of our team as they tell a story from on of our children's books in the shop.

name: The Queen's House
